text.div:
Generated Narrative: StructureDefinition ext-R5-CapabilityStatement.messaging

NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
Extension 0..*ExtensionIf messaging is supported
Slices for extension 0..*ExtensionExtension
Slice: Unordered, Open by value:url
extension:endpoint 0..*ExtensionWhere messages should be sent
Slices for extension 2..*ExtensionExtension
Slice: Unordered, Open by value:url
extension:protocol 1..1Extensionhttp | ftp | mllp +
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-CapabilityStatement.messaging.endpoint.protocol"
value[x] 1..1Codinghttp | ftp | mllp +
extension:address 1..1ExtensionNetwork address or identifier of the end-point
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-CapabilityStatement.messaging.endpoint.address"
value[x] 1..1urlNetwork address or identifier of the end-point
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-CapabilityStatement.messaging.endpoint"
value[x] 0..0Value of extension
extension:reliableCache 0..1ExtensionReliable Message Cache Length (min)
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-CapabilityStatement.messaging.reliableCache"
value[x] 0..1unsignedIntReliable Message Cache Length (min)
extension:documentation 0..1ExtensionMessaging interface behavior details
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-CapabilityStatement.messaging.documentation"
value[x] 0..1markdownMessaging interface behavior details
extension:supportedMessage 0..*ExtensionMessages supported by this system
Slices for extension 2..*ExtensionExtension
Slice: Unordered, Open by value:url
extension:mode 1..1Extensionsender | receiver
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-CapabilityStatement.messaging.supportedMessage.mode"
value[x] 1..1codesender | receiver
extension:definition 1..1ExtensionMessage supported by this system
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-CapabilityStatement.messaging.supportedMessage.definition"
value[x] 1..1canonical(Cross-version Profile for R5.MessageDefinition for use in FHIR R4 | MessageDefinition)Message supported by this system
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-CapabilityStatement.messaging.supportedMessage"
value[x] 0..0Value of extension
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-CapabilityStatement.messaging"
value[x] 0..0Value of extension

Documentation for this format

name: ExtensionCapabilityStatement_Messaging
title: Cross-version Extension `R5.CapabilityStatement.messaging` for use in FHIR R4
description: This cross-version extension represents the FHIR R5 element `CapabilityStatement.messaging` for use in FHIR R4.
purpose:
This extension is part of the cross-version definitions generated to enable use of the
element `CapabilityStatement.messaging` as defined in FHIR R5
in FHIR R4.

The source element is defined as:
`CapabilityStatement.messaging` 0..* `BackboneElement`

Across FHIR versions, the element set has been mapped as:
*  R5: `CapabilityStatement.messaging` 0..* `BackboneElement`
*  R4B: `CapabilityStatement.messaging` 0..* `BackboneElement`
*  R4: `CapabilityStatement.messaging` 0..* `BackboneElement`

Following are the generation technical comments:
Element `CapabilityStatement.messaging` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `CapabilityStatement.messaging`, but has no comparisons.

element.definition: A description of the messaging capabilities of the solution.
element.comment: Multiple repetitions allow the documentation of multiple endpoints per solution.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.definition: An Extension

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: An endpoint (network accessible address) to which messages and/or replies are to be sent.
element.requirements:
Element `CapabilityStatement.messaging.endpoint` is part of an existing definition because parent element `CapabilityStatement.messaging` requires a cross-version extension.
Element `CapabilityStatement.messaging.endpoint` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `CapabilityStatement.messaging.endpoint`, but has no comparisons.
